category1Resources.title: Product Owner
category1Resources.role: Leads the team to define vision, strategy and KPIs, driving alignment across the portfolio with needs of business.
category1Resources.description:
• Provides an escalation point for issue resolution.
  • Support delivery team to maintain velocity by rapidly removing team obstacles.
  • Creates and educates on agile culture and collaboration.
  • Sets development objectives and identifies opportunities for continuous improvement.

category1Resources.title: Quality Engineering Manager
category1Resources.role: Ensures quality approach is embedded in all deliverable assets produced by squads across the product lifecycle
category1Resources.description:
• Defines Automation Strategy and instils an automation first approach to design, coding and testing of new features.
  • Facilitate & guide quality between developers and QA to improve efficiencies and remove waste.
  • Build frameworks for better testability and quality outcomes.

category1Resources.title: Business Process Engineer
category1Resources.role: Supports redesign processes with lean methodologies to minimise waste and reduce bottleneck and handoffs.
category1Resources.description:
• Defines Automation Strategy and instils an automation first approach to design, coding and testing of new features.
  • Facilitate & guide quality between developers and QA to improve efficiencies and remove waste.
  • Build frameworks for better testability and quality outcomes.

category1Resources.title: Lead Business Analyst
category1Resources.role: Defines and owns the process of translating end-user / customer requirements into User Stories, complete with acceptance criteria.
category1Resources.description:
• Defines Automation Strategy and instils an automation first approach to design, coding and testing of new features.
  • Facilitate & guide quality between developers and QA to improve efficiencies and remove waste.
  • Build frameworks for better testability and quality outcomes.

category2Resources.title: Solution Architect
category2Resources.role: Owns conceptual architecture of the solution.
category2Resources.description:
• Develops initiative conceptual architecture, t-shirt sizing, identification of major capabilities / dependencies.
  • Owns seeking / managing architecture approvals through appropriate technology forums.
  • Oversees design and development of end-to-end solutions.

category2Resources.title: Business Architect
category2Resources.role: Provides product functional leadership and best practice direction.
category2Resources.description:
• Advises on functional product architecture direction.
  • Updates and validates the functional “Epic Level” backlog.
  • Works with the delivery squads to provide design reviews and functional leadership on implementation, customisations and integrations.

category2Resources.title: Data Architect
category2Resources.role: Set and direct data architecture principles for the solution.
category2Resources.description:
• Advises on functional product architecture direction.
  • Help define data models that enable the implementation of the intended business architecture to ensure alignment across the project and the broader enterprise.
  • Direct data standards for all its systems to manage interactions with integration partners.

category2Resources.title: Technical Architect
category2Resources.role: Provides product technical leadership and best practice.
category2Resources.description:
• Advises on technical product architecture direction.
  • Undertakes complex system integration configuration.
  • Works with the delivery team to provide design reviews and technical leadership on implementation, configuration and integrations.
  • Advises on complex installation requirements and provides hardware and architecture design recommendations.

category3Resources.title: Developer
category3Resources.description:
• Integrates new features and functionality during the current iterative sprint in accordance with the acceptance criteria.
  • Documents constructed features and functionalities.

category3Resources.title: Business Analyst
category3Resources.role: Works with the Product Owner to understand, elicit, analyse, document and communicate business requirements and articulate product vision with a strong focus on value delivery.
category3Resources.description:
• Translates end-user / customer requirements into stories complete with acceptance criteria, easily understood by the developers and testers.
  • Helps the Product Owner to define and own the value definition of Stories.
  • Collaborates with key stakeholders across business and technology to complete required artefacts and capture necessary input.

category3Resources.title: Quality Engineer
category3Resources.role: Facilitate & guide quality between developers and quality engineers to improve efficiencies and remove waste.
category3Resources.description:
• Build frameworks for better testability and quality outcomes, including test automation.
  • Test new features and functionality during the current iterative sprint in accordance with the acceptance criteria.
  • Creates and educates on agile culture and collaboration.

category3Resources.title: CX/BX Expert (UX/HCD)
category3Resources.role: Designs workflow using Human Centred-and Zero Based-Design.
category3Resources.description:
• Uses customer research to drive best user experience outcome.
  • Test prototypes and creates user friendly experience for the product.
  • Design the customer experience, interactions, and flows.
  • Builds design front-end digital solutions.

category3Resources.title: DevOps
category3Resources.role: Coordinate environment provisioning and integration activities with assets.
category3Resources.description:
• Ensure assets approach is in line with agreed standards and scalable across all delivery.
  • Enables self-service capabilities for developers and testers to allow Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment (CI/CD).
  • Provision development and testing environments.
  • Supports automation test suite execution.
  • Monitor performance.
